Excerpt: Modeling of case data reported March 27, 2020, as predicted by temperature, indicated a strong regional-level correlation between COVID-19 case rates and mean maximum surface air temperatures below 22.5oC.

Study: COVID-19 transmission in Mainland China is associated with temperature and humidity: a time-series analysis
Excerpt: Every 1C increase in the AT led to a decrease in the daily confirmed cases by 36% to 57% when ARH was in the range from 67% to 85.5%. Every 1% increase in ARH led to a decrease in the daily confirmed cases by 11% to 22% when AT was in the range from 5.04°C to 8.2°C. However, results were not consistent throughout provinces in mainland china
